title: Acute Coronary Syndrome - STEMI
pcr_text: 52-year-old male complaining of severe substernal chest pain radiating to left arm and jaw. Pain started 45 minutes ago while mowing lawn. Patient diaphoretic, anxious, BP 158/92, HR 110, RR 22, SpO2 96%.
correct_error: Acute STEMI presentation. Administer aspirin 324mg PO and prepare for immediate transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.
chaos_events: Patient refuses aspirin due to stomach issues

options.text: Administer aspirin 324mg PO, apply oxygen if needed, and transport immediately

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Nitroglycerin requires assessment for contraindications. Aspirin is first-line per 2022 Standards.

title: Acute Coronary Syndrome - NSTEMI
pcr_text: 68-year-old female with intermittent chest pressure for 2 hours. Pain described as 'heavy pressure' in center of chest. BP 145/85, HR 95, RR 18, SpO2 98%. History of hypertension.
correct_error: NSTEMI presentation. Administer aspirin and oxygen per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer aspirin 324mg PO and provide supplemental oxygen

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Assess for contraindications first. Aspirin is priority per 2022 Standards.

title: Congestive Heart Failure Exacerbation
pcr_text: 72-year-old male with severe shortness of breath, orthopnea, and bilateral lower extremity edema. Patient reports non-compliance with medications. BP 170/95, HR 115, RR 32, SpO2 88%.
correct_error: Acute CHF exacerbation. Provide high-flow oxygen and position upright per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.
chaos_events: Patient has CPAP machine at home

options.text: Administer high-flow oxygen and position patient upright

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Nitroglycerin requires Paramedic scope. Oxygen is EMT-B intervention per 2022 Standards.

title: Atrial Fibrillation with RVR
pcr_text: 65-year-old female with palpitations and shortness of breath. Patient reports irregular heartbeat. BP 135/80, HR 160 irregular, RR 24, SpO2 95%. History of AFib.
correct_error: AFib with rapid ventricular response. Provide oxygen and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Apply supplemental oxygen and monitor cardiac rhythm

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Adenosine requires Paramedic certification. Oxygen is EMT-B intervention per 2022 Standards.

title: COPD Exacerbation
pcr_text: 58-year-old male with severe shortness of breath and wheezing. Patient uses home oxygen and has history of COPD. BP 155/90, HR 105, RR 28, SpO2 90% on room air.
correct_error: Acute COPD exacerbation. Administer nebulized albuterol per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer nebulized albuterol and supplemental oxygen

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Albuterol is first-line bronchodilator. Ipratropium can be added but not alone per 2022 Standards.

title: Diabetic Ketoacidosis
pcr_text: 22-year-old female found confused with rapid breathing. Family reports patient is diabetic but hasn't taken insulin. Breath smells fruity. BP 110/70, HR 120, RR 32, SpO2 97%.
correct_error: DKA presentation. Provide oxygen and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.
chaos_events: Family has insulin but unsure dose

options.text: Provide supplemental oxygen and monitor ABCs

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Insulin administration requires Paramedic certification. Oxygen is EMT-B intervention per 2022 Standards.

title: Hypoglycemia - Unconscious
pcr_text: 45-year-old male unresponsive, family reports diabetes. Blood glucose check shows 35 mg/dL. Patient has gag reflex.
correct_error: Severe hypoglycemia. Administer oral glucose or glucagon per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer oral glucose paste between cheek and gums

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Glucagon requires assessment for contraindications. Oral glucose is first-line per 2022 Standards.

title: Hypoglycemia - Conscious
pcr_text: 35-year-old female diaphoretic, anxious, and confused. Patient reports diabetes and last insulin dose 4 hours ago. Blood glucose 45 mg/dL.
correct_error: Hypoglycemia in conscious patient. Administer oral glucose per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer oral glucose and reassess blood sugar

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Oral glucose is preferred for conscious patients. Glucagon is for unconscious per 2022 Standards.

title: Acute Stroke - Left MCA
pcr_text: 78-year-old female with sudden onset right-sided weakness, facial droop, and slurred speech. Symptoms started 30 minutes ago. BP 185/95, HR 85, RR 16, SpO2 98%.
correct_error: Acute ischemic stroke. Assess Cincinnati Prehospital Stroke Scale and transport to stroke center per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.
chaos_events: Patient last seen normal 1 hour ago

options.text: Perform Cincinnati Stroke Scale and transport immediately

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Aspirin not indicated for acute stroke. Transport is priority per 2022 Standards.

title: Seizure - Post-Ictal
pcr_text: 42-year-old male post-seizure, confused and combative. Witness reports 3-minute tonic-clonic seizure. Patient has epilepsy. BP 140/85, HR 95, RR 18, SpO2 97%.
correct_error: Post-ictal state. Ensure ABCs and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Monitor ABCs and transport for evaluation

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Benzodiazepines require Paramedic certification. Support ABCs per 2022 Standards.

title: Acute Asthma - Status Asthmaticus
pcr_text: 28-year-old female with severe wheezing, unable to speak in full sentences, tripod positioning. No response to home inhaler. BP 125/80, HR 135, RR 35, SpO2 88%.
correct_error: Status asthmaticus. Administer nebulized albuterol and oxygen per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer nebulized albuterol and high-flow oxygen

options.feedback: INCORRECT! Epinephrine indicated for anaphylaxis, not asthma. Albuterol is first-line per 2022 Standards.

title: Pulmonary Embolism
pcr_text: 55-year-old female with sudden onset shortness of breath and pleuritic chest pain. Recent long airplane flight. BP 135/80, HR 110, RR 26, SpO2 92%.
correct_error: Suspected pulmonary embolism. Provide oxygen and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer supplemental oxygen and transport immediately

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Anticoagulation requires hospital. Oxygen is EMT-B intervention per 2022 Standards.

title: Acute Gastroenteritis
pcr_text: 32-year-old male with severe abdominal pain, nausea, and diarrhea. Patient appears dehydrated with dry mucous membranes. BP 100/60, HR 115, RR 20, SpO2 98%.
correct_error: Acute gastroenteritis with dehydration. Monitor ABCs and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Monitor vital signs and transport for IV fluids

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Anti-emetics require Paramedic certification. Support ABCs per 2022 Standards.

title: Sepsis - Urosepsis
pcr_text: 75-year-old female with fever, chills, and confusion. Family reports urinary tract infection symptoms. BP 85/50, HR 125, RR 28, SpO2 95%, temp 103.2°F.
correct_error: Sepsis presentation. Provide oxygen and rapid transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer supplemental oxygen and transport immediately

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Antibiotics require Paramedic certification. Oxygen is EMT-B intervention per 2022 Standards.

title: Acute Renal Failure
pcr_text: 68-year-old male with shortness of breath and confusion. History of diabetes and hypertension. Patient reports decreased urine output. BP 160/90, HR 95, RR 22, SpO2 94%.
correct_error: Acute renal failure with fluid overload. Provide oxygen and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Provide supplemental oxygen and monitor ABCs

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Medication administration requires Paramedic certification. Oxygen is EMT-B intervention per 2022 Standards.

title: Thyroid Storm
pcr_text: 45-year-old female with tachycardia, fever, and altered mental status. Patient has history of hyperthyroidism. BP 170/100, HR 150, RR 24, SpO2 96%, temp 104.5°F.
correct_error: Thyroid storm. Provide cooling and oxygen per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Provide supplemental oxygen and cooling measures

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Beta-blockers require Paramedic certification. Support ABCs per 2022 Standards.

title: Myasthenic Crisis
pcr_text: 52-year-old male with severe muscle weakness and respiratory distress. Patient has myasthenia gravis. BP 120/80, HR 95, RR 30, SpO2 90%.
correct_error: Myasthenic crisis. Provide oxygen and ventilatory support per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer high-flow oxygen and assist ventilation if needed

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Emergency medications require Paramedic certification. Oxygen is EMT-B intervention per 2022 Standards.

title: Addisonian Crisis
pcr_text: 38-year-old female with weakness, nausea, and hypotension. Patient has Addison's disease. BP 80/50, HR 120, RR 20, SpO2 97%.
correct_error: Addisonian crisis. Provide oxygen and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Administer supplemental oxygen and monitor ABCs

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Steroid administration requires Paramedic certification. Support ABCs per 2022 Standards.

title: Acute Pancreatitis
pcr_text: 55-year-old male with severe epigastric pain radiating to back. Patient reports alcohol use. BP 135/85, HR 105, RR 22, SpO2 96%.
correct_error: Acute pancreatitis. Provide pain management and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Monitor vital signs and transport for pain control

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! IV opioids require Paramedic certification. Transport is priority per 2022 Standards.

title: Cholecystitis
pcr_text: 42-year-old female with right upper quadrant abdominal pain and nausea. Pain worse after eating fatty foods. BP 125/75, HR 95, RR 18, SpO2 98%.
correct_error: Acute cholecystitis. Monitor ABCs and transport per 2022 National EMS Education Standards.

options.text: Monitor vital signs and transport for evaluation

options.feedback: OUT OF SCOPE! Anti-emetics require Paramedic certification. Support ABCs per 2022 Standards.
